title: Understanding Kinetic Energy
text: Kinetic energy is related to the motion of particles. At a given temperature, the average kinetic energy of gas particles is the same for all gases.

title: Average Kinetic Energy Formula
text: The average kinetic energy of gas particles can be calculated using the formula: $$KE_{avg}=\frac{3}{2} k T$$, where k is the Boltzmann constant and T is the temperature in Kelvin.

title: Temperature and Kinetic Energy
text: Remember that the average kinetic energy of gas particles depends only on the temperature, not on the type of gas.

hintAnswer: They all have the same average kinetic energy
title: Comparing Gases at the Same Temperature
text: If all gases are at the same temperature, what can you say about their average kinetic energy?
choices: They all have the same average $$ \cup _{rms}$$
